content.prompt: Which of the following describes the activities represented by data in the table?

choices.label: Interest groups form political action committees (PACs) to nominate candidates during elections.
Government agencies receive a large portion of their funding from private interest groups, which affects their decisions.
Groups in American society form political action committees (PACs) so they can influence policy.
There are no limits on the amount of money an individual may contribute to a political action committee (PAC).
